poem:
### Trust Fractured

In Bristol's web of disbelief,  
parents, like shadows, stand alone;  
their whispers run like autumn leaf,  
each breath a muted, mournful moan.  

Through eyes of surveillance, cold as stone,  
trust in sunken footsteps fades;  
once vibrant faith now overthrown,  
truth's promise in secret betrays.

More than three years have passed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
